content: We just deployed to this server only (not merged yet) an experimental change to the PM colors from #4567 (fun PR number!).
We'd love feedback on how people feel about this vs. the old yellow
(As a sidenote, I expect we'll be doing further iteration on colors and things over the coming weeks; I'm sure some experiments will work and others will not. So just let us know what you think!)
I like it! Way more subtle than the old colors, but you still notice you're in PMs.
What would you think of having the colored background for PMs in Home view, but white background in any PM narrow?
I think they should always be the same color. I think the visual cue is helpful.
We could try it out. My fear with that approach would be that consistency in style in important.

I feel the the #ffe4e0 color of @Mention looks kind of weird along with the new color. Also we may have to change the reaction button color (It turns blue when the user reacts which is almost the same as the current pm color).
Agree that the red color for being mentioned would also want to change. We've been thinking about just getting rid of that, and just coloring the @mention itself (and not the rest of the message)
The reactions color point is an interesting one. Hmm.

Agree with the @-mention comment; will send out a proposal in a bit.

For the PM-narrow color: The page feels kind of dark to me when I'm in PMs? I'm not sure if that's just because I'm not used to it.
OK let's do a quick emoji-reactions powered vote on the new colors. if you like the blue, if you preferred the yellow.
We'll collect votes for a day or two, so folks are encouraged to vote even if you see this a while from now :)
May depend on the monitor; it's a light blue-grey
